intro: Chromolaena umbelliformis, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant has palmate leaves that are usually lobed and can reach up to 30 cm in length. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields due to its aggressive growth and adaptability. Chromolaena umbelliformis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
